newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold prices fall in line with world markeT.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold prices fall in line with world markeT.

text.p: Volume on the Istanbul gold exchange dropped from Wednesday's 1,527 kilos, but remained relatively high at 1,186 kilos on Thursday as easier prices encouraged arbitrage as well as some physical demand, dealers said.
Gold closed at $354.50 an ounce and 1,419,000 lira per gram, down from yesterday's $356.50 and 1,424,000 lira on softer world prices earlier in the day.
The Turkish currency eased to 124,320 lira to the dollar from 124,070 lira at Wednesday's close, reflecting the dollar's gains against the mark.
Dealers said this enabled banks to conduct arbitrage deals by buying gold in dollars and reselling in lira.
Of the day's turnover, 1,006 kilos changed hands in the morning session and 61.1 percent of the total was conducted in dollar terms.
